      • getPartitions

        public void getPartitions(Map<InternalVertex,PartitionAssignment> vertices)
        Description copied from interface: IDPlacementStrategy
        Bulk assignment of idAuthorities to vertices.

        It is expected that the passed in map contains the partition assignment after this method returns. Any initial values in the map are meaningless and to be ignored.

        This is an optional operation. Check with IDPlacementStrategy.supportsBulkPlacement() first.

        Specified by:
        getPartitions in interface IDPlacementStrategy
        Parameters:
        vertices - Map containing all vertices and their partition placement.

      • supportsBulkPlacement

        public boolean supportsBulkPlacement()
        Description copied from interface: IDPlacementStrategy
        Whether this placement strategy supports bulk placement. If not, then IDPlacementStrategy.getPartitions(java.util.Map) will throw UnsupportedOperationException
        Specified by:
        supportsBulkPlacement in interface IDPlacementStrategy
        Returns:

      • setLocalPartitionBounds

        public void setLocalPartitionBounds(int lowerID,
                           int upperID,
                           int idLimit)
        Description copied from interface: IDPlacementStrategy
        If Titan is embedded, this method is used to indicate to the placement strategy which part of the id space is hosted locally.

        This method can be called at any time while Titan is running. It is typically called right after construction and when the id space is redistributed.

        Note, that the portion of the locally hosted keyspace may "wrap around", meaning that the lowerID>upperID which describes the id block starting at lowerID (inclusive) than wrapping around idLimit (exclusive) to upperID (exclusive).

        Specified by:
        setLocalPartitionBounds in interface IDPlacementStrategy
        Parameters:
        lowerID - lower bound of the locally hosted id space (inclusive)
        upperID - upper bound of the locally hosted id space (exclusive)
        idLimit - any valid partition id must be smaller than this limit. Used to compute wrap arounds.

      • exhaustedPartition

        public void exhaustedPartition(int partitionID)
        Description copied from interface: IDPlacementStrategy
        Called when there are no more idAuthorities left in the given partition. It is expected that the placement strategy will no longer use said partition in its placement suggestions.
        Specified by:
        exhaustedPartition in interface IDPlacementStrategy
        Parameters:
        partitionID - Id of the partition that has been exhausted.
